summary: The document is an FBI identification form pertaining to the JFK assassination, focusing on John Roselli. It outlines his financial activities, such as depositing a $25,000.00 check at Fidelity Bank in Beverly Hills, California, on July 11, 1963, and his movements, including his stay in Los Angeles until September 20, 1963, before leaving for Las Vegas, Nevada. The document also details changes in Roselli's phone number and his associations, particularly with Gordon Nesser, underlining investigations by the Los Angeles Police Department and the IRS into these connections and potential real estate investments.
key_findings: John Roselli deposited a $25,000.00 check to his account at the Fidelity Bank, Beverly Hills, California, on 7/11/63.
Roselli's phone number OL 4-7164 was no longer his since March 1961, but he received calls at this number in care of Gordon Nesser.
The Los Angeles Police Department and IRS were investigating Roselli's connections, including his relationship with Gordon Nesser and potential real estate investments.
Roselli was in Los Angeles until 9/20/63 when he departed for Las Vegas, Nevada.
